</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Investment in Preferred Stock of Private Company</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">On&#160;December 15, 2017, the Company and Sandstone Diagnostics, Inc. (</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000">&#8220;Sandstone</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#8221;) entered into a Series A1 Preferred Stock Purchase Agreement (</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000">&#8220;Loan Agreement&#8221;</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">) pursuant to which the Company purchased 976,286 shares of Sandstone&#8217;s Series A1 Preferred Shares for $1,000.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Sandstone is a medical device company focused on a data-driven approach to men&#8217;s reproductive health. Founded in 2012 in part by government scientists from Sandia National Laboratories, Sandstone&#8217;s mission is to provide innovative, data-driven tools to help men assess, manage, and improve their reproductive health.&#160;The funding from the Series A1 Preferred Stock financing will support sales growth </font>and continued product development leveraging the company&#8217;s unique technology platform, Sandstone&#8217;s&#160;Trak&#8482; Male Fertility Testing System.</div>

<div style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff"><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The Company elected to follow the guidance of ASC No. 321,<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic"> Equity Securities</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#160;(</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000">&#8220;ASC 321&#8221;</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">)</font>, which provides a measurement alternative to the requirement to carry equity interests at fair value in accordance with ASC 820, Fair value measurement, for certain equity interests without readily determinable fair values. Equity interests measured in accordance with the measurement alternative in ASC 321 are not required to be included within the fair value hierarchy. The Company&#8217;s equity investment in Sandstone is recorded at cost. However, any change to the carrying amount will be subsequently adjusted up or down for observable price changes (i.e., prices in orderly transactions for the identical investment or similar investment of the same issuer) and any adjustments to the carrying amount shall be recorded in net income.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Other Investments</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">On&#160;November 1, 2017, the Company and I. AM, Inc. (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;I. AM</font>&#8221;) entered into a Loan and Security Agreement pursuant to which the Company provided I.AM a non-revolving credit facility of up to $1,300 for a period ending on September 25, 2022. As of December 31, 2017, the Company had provided loans of $1,234 to I. AM which accrue interest at a rate of 6.0% on the outstanding daily balance. The Loan Agreement is secured by the assets of I.AM&#8217;s membership interests in three restaurant LLCs. During 2017, the Company provided additional loans of $403. These additional loans and the Company&#8217;s investment in I. AM are carried at amortized cost.</div>

<div><br>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">11. OTHER INVESTMENTS, RELATED PARTIES</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The Company&#8217;s other related party investments primarily consist of two investments.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">MTIX, Ltd.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">On December 5, 2017, the Company entered into an exchange agreement with WT Johnson pursuant to which the Company issued to WT Johnson two convertible promissory notes in the principal amount of $600 (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Note A&#8221;</font>) and $1,668 (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Note B&#8221;</font>), in exchange for cancellation of amounts due to WT Johnson by MTIX Ltd., a related party of the Company.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">During December 2017, the Company issued 600,000 shares of its common stock to WT Johnson &amp; Sons upon the conversion of Note A and WT Johnson subsequently sold the 600,000 shares. The proceeds from the sale of Note A were sufficient to satisfy the entire $2,268 obligation as well as an additional $400 of value added tax due to WT Johnson. Concurrent with entering into the exchange agreement, the Company received a promissory note in the amount of $2,668 from MTIX and cancelled Note B. At December 31, 2017, the Company has valued the note receivable at $600, the carrying amount of Note A. The Company will recognize the remainder of the amount due from MTIX upon payment of the promissory note by MTIX</font>.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Israeli Property</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">During the year ended December 31, 2017, our President, Amos Kohn, purchased certain real property that will serve as a facility for the Company&#8217;s business operations in Israel. The Company made $300 of payments to the seller of the property and received a<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000"> 28% undivided interest in the real property (&#8220;Property&#8217;). The Company&#8217;s subsidiary, Coolisys, entered into a Trust Agreement and Tenancy In Common Agreement with Roni Kohn, who owns a 72% interest in the Property, is the daughter of Mr. Kohn and is an Israeli citizen. The Property was purchased to serve as a residence/office facility for the Company in order to oversee its European operations and to expand its business in the hi-tech industry located in Israel. Pursuant to the Trust Agreement, the Ms. Kohn will hold and manage Coolisys&#8217; undivided 28% interest in the Property. The trust will be in effect until it is terminated by mutual agreement of the parties. During the term of the trust, the Ms. Kohn will not sell, lease, sublease, transfer, grant, encumber, change or effect any other disposition with respect to the Property or the Coolisys&#8217; interest without the Company&#8217;s approval.</font></div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<div>&#160;</div>

<div><!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 163 --><div style="margin-top: 8pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; text-align: center">
<p style="margin-top: 0pt; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Times New Roman, Times, serif; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal">F-<!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->26<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p>
</div><div style="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 8pt">
<p style="margin: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
</div><!-- Field: /Page --></div>

<div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DPW HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DECEMBER 31, 2017</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share data</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</div>

<hr style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto" align="center" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Under the Tenancy In Common Agreement, Coolisys and its executive officers shall have the exclusive rights to use the Property for the Company and its affiliates&#8217; business operations. The Property shall be managed by the Ms. Kohn. Further, pursuant to the Tenancy In Common Agreement, for each completed calendar month of employment of Mr. Kohn by the Company, Ms. Kohn shall have the right to purchase a portion of the Company&#8217;s interest in the Property. Such right shall fully vest at the end of five years of continuous employment and the Trustee shall have the right to purchase the Company&#8217;s 28% interest in the Property for a nominal value. The Company will amortize its $300,000 investment over ten years, subject to a cliff vesting after five years. During the year ended December 31, 2017, the Company recognized $8 in amortization expense. In the event that Mr. Kohn is not employed by the Company, the Company shall have the right to demand that Ms. Kohn purchase the Company&#8217;s remaining interest in the Property that was not subject to vesting for the fair value market value of such unvested Property interest.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Other investments and interest receivable</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">During the year ended December 31, 2017, DP Lending made loans to Alzamend Neuro, Inc. (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Alzamend&#8221;</font>), in the amount of $44. <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">AVLP is a party to a </font>management services agreement pursuant to which Avalanche provides management, consulting and financial services to Alzamend. At December 31, 2017, the outstanding principal under these loans was $13. As additional consideration, the Company received a warrant to purchase 22,000 shares of Alzamend&#8217;s common stock at an exercise price of $0.30 per share of common stock. Finally, the Company has accrued interest of $11 from its lending activities.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left">12. ACQUISITIONS</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left">Microphase Corporation</div>

<div><br>
</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">On April 28, 2017, the Company entered into a share exchange agreement with Microphase; Microphase Holding Company LLC, a limited liability company organized under the laws of Connecticut (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;MHC&#8221;</font>), Ergul Family Limited Partnership, a partnership organized under the laws of Connecticut (&#8220;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EFLP</font>&#8221;) RCKJ Trust, a trust organized under the laws of New Jersey (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;RCKJ&#8221; </font>and with MHC and EFLP, the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Significant Stockholders&#8221;</font>) and those additional persons who have executed the share exchange agreement (collectively, the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Minority Stockholders&#8221;</font> and with the Significant Stockholders, the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Stockholders&#8221;</font>).&#160;&#160;Upon the terms and subject to the conditions set forth in the share exchange greement, the Company acquired 1,603,434 shares (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Subject Shares&#8221;</font>) of the issued and outstanding common stock of Microphase (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;MPC Common Stock&#8221;</font>), from the Stockholders in exchange for the issuance by the Company of 1,842,448 shares of DPW common stock (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Common Stock&#8221;</font>) and 378,776 shares of DPW Series D Preferred Stock (collectively, the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#8220;Exchange Shares&#8221;</font>), which shares of DPW Series D Preferred Stock are convertible into an aggregate of 757,552 shares of Common Stock and warrants to purchase an aggregate of 1,000,000 shares of Common Stock.&#160; At the time of the closing of the acquisition the Exchange Shares constituted <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">56.4% of the outstanding equity interests of Microphase Corporation</font>. <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">The operating results of Microphase from the closing date of the acquisition, June 2, 2017, through December 31, 2017, are included in the consolidated financial statements.</font></div>

<div style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">&#160;&#160;&#160; <br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">At closing, the purchase price of Digital Power&#8217;s 56.4% interest in Microphase was determined to be $1,451, comprised of the Exchange Shares, valued at $1,222 based on the closing price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on June 2, 2017 of $0.47 per share, and the warrants, valued at $229.</font> The Company computed the fair value of these warrants using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. The risk-free rate of 1.4% was derived from the U.S. Treasury yield curve, matching the warrant&#8217;s term, in effect at the measurement date. The volatility factor of 105.9% was determined based on the Company&#8217;s historical stock prices.</div>

<div style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">
<div>&#160;&#160;&#160; </div>

<div><!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 164 --><div style="margin-top: 8pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; text-align: center">
<p style="margin-top: 0pt; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Times New Roman, Times, serif; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal">F-<!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->27<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p>
</div><div style="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 8pt">
<p style="margin: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
</div><!-- Field: /Page --></div>

<div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DPW HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DECEMBER 31, 2017</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share data</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</div>

<hr style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto" align="center" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div><br>
&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">Power-Plus Technical Distributors</div>

<div style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff"><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">On August 3, 2017, Coolisys entered into a Securities Purchase Agreement (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Purchase Agreement&#8221;</font>) to acquire all the outstanding membership Interests of Power-Plus. Power-Plus is an industrial distributor of value added power supply solutions, UPS systems, fans, filters, line cords, and other power-related components. On September 1, 2017, Coolisys completed the acquisition.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Under the&#160;terms of the Agreement, Coolisys Technologies acquired all the membership Interests of Power-Plus for a price of $850, which was reduced by certain debts of Power-Plus in the amount of $186. The purchase price of $664 was paid by (i) a two-year promissory note in the amount of $255 payable in 24 monthly installments; and (ii) cash at closing of $409 resulting in a net purchase price of $664.</div>

<div style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff"><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The acquisition of Microphase and Power-Plus is being accounted for under the purchase method of accounting in accordance with ASC No. 805,&#160;<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">Business Combinations</font>. Under the purchase method, assets acquired and liabilities assumed are recorded at their estimated fair values. Goodwill is recorded to the extent the purchase price exceeds the fair value of the net identifiable tangible and intangible assets acquired less liabilities assumed at the date of acquisition.</div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The components of the purchase price are as follows:</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The following pro forma data summarizes the results of operations for the periods indicated as if the Microphase and Power-Plus acquisitions had been completed as of the beginning of each period presented. The pro forma data gives effect to actual operating results prior to the acquisition. These pro forma amounts do not purport to be indicative of the results that would have actually been obtained if the acquisition occurred as of the beginning of each period presented or that may be obtained in future periods:</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: left; CLEAR: both">&#160;&#160;&#160; </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: left">13. STOCK-BASED COMPENSATION</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Under the Company's 2017 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2017&#8221; Plan), 2016 Stock Incentive Plan (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;2016 Plan&#8221;</font>) and the 2012 Stock Option Plan, as amended (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;2012 Plan&#8221;</font>) (collectively, the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Plans&#8221;</font>), options may be granted to employees, officers, consultants, service providers and directors of the Company. The Plans, as amended, provide for the issuance of a maximum of 7,372,630 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock. The Company also has 206,000 outstanding options that were granted between 2009 and 2011 pursuant to the terms of the Company's 2002 Stock Option Plan (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;2002 Plan&#8221;</font>). Options granted pursuant to the 2002 Plan expire between September 2008 and February 2021.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Options granted under the Plans have an exercise price equal to or greater than the fair value of the underlying common stock at the date of grant and become exercisable based on a vesting schedule&#160;determined at the date of grant. Typically, options granted generally become fully vested after four years. Any options that are forfeited or cancelled before expiration become available for future grants. The options expire between 5 and 10&#160;years from the date of grant.&#160; Restricted stock awards granted under the Plans are subject to a vesting period determined at the date of grant. As of December 31, 2017, an aggregate of 2,538,832 of the Company's options are still available for future grant.</div>

<div>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">During the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company granted 810,000 and 1,800,000 options, respectively, from the Plans to its employees at an average exercise price of $0.84 and $0.67, respectively, per share.&#160; These options become fully vested after four years. The Company estimated that the grant date fair value of options granted utilizing the Black-Scholes option pricing model during the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016 was $482 and $820, respectively, which is being recognized as stock-based compensation expense over the requisite four-year service period. During the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company also issued 1,948,798 and nil, respectively, shares of common stock to its consultants and service providers pursuant to the 2016 Plan. The Company estimated that the grant date fair value of these shares of common stock was $1,532, <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">which was determined from the closing price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of issuance.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">&#160;&#160;&#160; <br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">The Company</font> has valued the options at their date of grant utilizing the Black-Scholes option pricing model.&#160; This model is dependent upon several variables such as the options&#8217; term, exercise price, current stock price, risk-free interest rate estimated over the expected term and estimated volatility of our stock over the expected term of the options. The risk-free interest rate used in the calculations is based on the implied yield available on U.S. Treasury issues with an equivalent term approximating the expected life of the options as calculated using the simplified method. The estimated volatility was determined based on the historical volatility of our common stock.</div>

<div>
<div>&#160;</div>

</div><div style="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 8pt">

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DECEMBER 31, 2017</div>

</table>
</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both">&#160;</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The combination of stock-based compensation of $1,578 from the issuances of equity-based awards pursuant to the Plans and stock-based compensation attributed to stock awards of $130 and warrants and options of $123, which were issued outside of the Plans, resulted in aggregate stock-based compensation of $1,831 during the year ended December 31, 2017. During the year ended December 31, 2017, the Company issued 1,100,000 options to purchase shares of common stock at $1.38 per share to its directors and officers. These shares were issued outside of the Plans and are subject to shareholder approval. During the year ended December 31, 2016, the only stock-based compensation expense was from issuances pursuant to the Plans.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">As of December 31, 2017, there was $606 of unrecognized compensation cost related to non-vested stock-based compensation arrangements granted under the Company's stock option plans. That cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2.8 years.</div>

WARRANTS</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#160;</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">During the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company issued a total of 10,379,981 warrants at an average exercise price of $0.81 per share.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z7ff1d25dba734081987d3e52ae11fbd6" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 36pt; align: right">(iii)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">On </font>November 15, 2016<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">, the Company issued </font>three-year warrants to purchase 901,666 shares of common stock each at a per share exercise price of $0.80 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">in connection with </font>subscription agreements entered into with nine accredited investors. Pursuant to the terms of the subscription agreements, the Company sold 901,666 units at $0.60 for an aggregate purchase price of approximately $541. Each unit consists of one share of common stock and one warrant to purchase one share of common stock<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">&#160;</font>(See Note 23).</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Warrant issuances during 2017</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">During the year ended December 31, 2017, the Company issued a total of 8,630,855 warrants at an average exercise price of $0.83 per share.</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">

The warrants to purchase 2.1 Units equates to a warrant to purchase 182,003 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at $0.72 per share and a second warrant to purchase 182,003 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at $1.00 per share (See Note 23).</font></div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The following table summarizes information about common stock warrants outstanding at December 31, 2017:</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<table id="z7d56f03d89f04e0f8fe4c5fac5e55291" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">
<tr>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; WHITE-SPACE: nowrap; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid" colspan="5">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">Outstanding</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; WHITE-SPACE: nowrap; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 1%">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: left">&#160;</div>
</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom; WHITE-SPACE: nowrap; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 16%">

<div>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">The Company</font> has valued the warrants at their date of grant utilizing the Black-Scholes option pricing model.&#160; This model is dependent upon several variables such as the warrants&#8217; term, exercise price, current stock price, risk-free interest rate and estimated volatility of our stock over the contractual term of the warrants. The risk-free interest rate used in the calculations is based on the implied yield available on U.S. Treasury issues with an equivalent term approximating the contractual life of the warrants.</div>

<div>&#160;&#160; </div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">The Company utilized the Black-Scholes option pricing model and the assumptions used during the </font>years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">:</font></div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">16. ADVANCES ON FUTURE RECEIPTS</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Between July 6, 2017 and November 1, 2017, the Company&#160;received funding as a result of entering&#160;into multiple Agreements for the Purchase and Sale of Future Receipts with TVT Capital, LLC pursuant to which the Company sold in the aggregate $4,068 in future receipts of the Company for $2,889. Under the terms of the agreements, the Company will be obligated to pay the initial daily amount of $19 until the $4,068 has been paid in full. As of December 31, 2017, the Company had repaid $1,526. The term future receipts means cash, check, ACH, credit card, debit card, bank card, charged card or other form of monetary payment. The</font> Company recorded a discount in the amount of $1,179 which is reflected as a reduction on the outstanding liability. The discount is being amortized as non-cash interest expense over the term of the agreement. During the years ended December 31, 2017, non-cash interest expense of $600 was recorded from the amortization of debt discounts.</div>

<div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<div><!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 171 --><div style="margin-top: 8pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; text-align: center">
<p style="margin-top: 0pt; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Times New Roman, Times, serif; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal">F-<!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->34<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p>
</div><div style="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 8pt">
<p style="margin: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
</div><!-- Field: /Page --></div>

<div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DPW HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DECEMBER 31, 2017</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share data</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</div>

<hr style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto" align="center" noshade="noshade">

</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">17. REVOLVING CREDIT FACILITY</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Microphase entered into a revolving loan agreement with Gerber Finance, Inc. (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Gerber&#8221;</font>) in February of 2012, as amended in September 2015 and July 2017 (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Revolving Credit Facility&#8221;</font>).&#160;Under the Revolving Credit Facility, Microphase received funds based on a borrowing base, which consisted of a percentage of eligible accounts receivable, up to a maximum revolving amount of $1,400 (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Maximum Revolving Amount&#8221;</font>). Pursuant to the terms of the Revolving Credit Facility, Microphase was subject to an annual facility fee in an amount equal to 1.75% of the Maximum Revolving Amount due on each anniversary, a monthly collateral monitoring fees of $1 and other fees. <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Interest accrued at the </font>prime rate plus three and three-quarters percent (3.75%) on the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">unpaid principal</font>. Effective June 15, 2017, the prime rate was increased from 4.00% to 4.25% resulting in a base rate of 8.00%. In December 2017, the Company paid off the Revolving Credit Facility in cash. The interest expense for the period from June 3, 2017 (date loan was assumed) to December 31, 2017 was $84.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">On November 6, 2017, Microphase entered into a factoring agreement with CSNK Working Capital Finance Corp. (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Factoring Agreement&#8221;</font>). Under the Factoring Agreement, Microphase received funds based on a borrowing base, which consisted solely of eligible accounts receivable.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; CLEAR: both">
<table id="z8f851759daf94ab5a998ea3886b3b3de" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(a)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">At December 31, 2017, Microphase had guaranteed the repayment of two equity lines of credit in the aggregate amount of $300 with Wells Fargo Bank, NA (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Wells Fargo&#8221;</font>) (collectively, the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Wells Fargo Notes&#8221;</font>). These loans originated prior to the Company&#8217;s acquisition of Microphase and Microphase was the recipient of the actual proceeds from the loans. Microphase had previously guaranteed the payment under the first Wells Fargo equity line during 2008, the proceeds of which Microphase had received from a concurrent loan from Edson Realty Inc., a related party owned real estate holding company. As of December 31, 2017, the first line of credit, which is secured by residential real estate owned by a former officer, had an outstanding balance of $212, with an annual interest rate of 4.00%. Microphase had guaranteed the payment under the second Wells Fargo equity line in 2014. Microphase had received working capital loans from the former CEO from funds that were drawn against the second Wells Fargo equity line. As of December 31, 2017, the second line of credit, secured by the former CEO&#8217;s principal residence, had an outstanding balance of $88, with an annual interest rate of 3.00%. During the period June 3, 2017 to December 31, 2017, Microphase incurred $8 of interest on the Wells Fargo Notes.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </div>

<div>
<div><!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 172 --><div style="margin-top: 8pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; text-align: center">
<p style="margin-top: 0pt; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Times New Roman, Times, serif; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal">F-<!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->35<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p>
</div><div style="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 8pt">
<p style="margin: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
</div><!-- Field: /Page --></div>

<div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DPW HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DECEMBER 31, 2017</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share data</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</div>

<hr style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto" align="center" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z832141e2adb2473ebfc53b6090f00c02" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(b)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">In August 2016, Microphase received a $300 loan, of which $8 has been repaid, pursuant to the State of Connecticut Small Business Express Job Creation Incentive Program which is administered through the Department of Economic and Community Development (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;DECD&#8221;</font>) (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;DECD Note&#8221;</font>). The DECD Note bears interest at a rate of 3% per annum and is due in August 2026. Payment of principal and interest was deferred during the initial year and commencing in September 2017, payable in equal monthly installments over the remaining term. During the period June 3, 2017 to December 31, 2017, Microphase incurred $5 of interest on the DECD Note. In conjunction with the DECD Note, Microphase was awarded and received a Small Business Express Matching Grant of $100 by the State of Connecticut. State grant funding requires Microphase to spend an equal amount of cash on eligible expense. The Company has utilized $18 of the grant and the balance of $82 is reported within deferred revenue and classified in accounts payable and accrued in the accompanying consolidated balance sheet at December 31, 2017.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z313eec9160e34bcaae00688a7d3af08d" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(c)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">At December 31, 2017, Power-Plus had guaranteed the repayment of two lines of credit in the aggregate amount of $169 with Bank of America NA (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;B of A&#8221;</font>) and Wells Fargo (collectively, the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Power-Plus Lines&#8221;</font>). As of December 31, 2017, the B of A line of credit had an outstanding balance of $97, with an annual interest rate of 6.25%. As of December 31, 2017, the Wells Fargo line of credit had an outstanding balance of $74, with an annual interest rate of 10.00%. During the period September 2 to December 31, 2017, Power-Plus incurred $4 of interest on the Power-Plus Lines.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="zb0d9d3fcbb684c77bdc072af09466c79" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(d)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Pursuant to the terms of the Purchase Agreement with Power-Plus, the Company entered into a two-year promissory note in the amount of $255 payable to the former owner as part of the purchase consideration. The $255 note is payable in 24 equal monthly installments. </font>On&#160;October 18, 2017, for cancellation of debt, the Company entered into a subscription agreement with the former owner under which the Company sold 138,806 shares of common stock at $0.67&#160;per share for an aggregate purchase price of $93 (See Note 23).</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z0c53152419c649afb13a8094fe5c8f99" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(e)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">In December 2016, Microphase utilized a $20 overdraft credit line at People&#8217;s United Bank with an annual interest rate of 15%. As of December 31, 2017, the balance of that overdraft credit line was $19.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z2cead84ba95845ec95253503b299db34" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(f)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">In December 2016, Microphase issued $705 in 10% short-term promissory notes to nineteen accredited investors which, after deducting $71 of placement fees to its selling agent, Spartan Capital Securities, LLC (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Spartan&#8221;</font>), resulted in $634 in net proceeds to Microphase (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;10% Short-Term Notes&#8221;</font>). The 10% Short-Term Notes were due one year from the date of issuance. The amount due pursuant to the 10% Short-Term Notes is equal to the entire original principal amount multiplied by 125% (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Loan Premium&#8221;</font>) plus accrued interest. During the period June 3, 2017 to December 31, 2017, Microphase incurred $44 of interest on these 10% short-term promissory notes. <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">On December 5, 2017, in exchange for the cancellation of $690 of outstanding principal and $250 of accrued interest owed to the investors by Microphase Corporation, the Company entered into an Exchange Agreement pursuant to which the Company issued an aggregate of 1,523,852 shares of common stock and warrants to purchase 380,466 shares of common stock with an exercise price of $1.10 per share of common stock, (See Note 23).</font></div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z9586eecfc833484ebc55b0636cdba21a" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(g)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">On June 2, 2017, pursuant to the terms of the Share Exchange Agreement and in consideration of legal services, Microphase issued a $450 8% promissory note with a maturity date of November 25, 2017 to Lucosky Brookman, LLP (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Lucosky Note&#8221;</font>). In conjunction with the issuance of the Lucosky Note, the Company issued Lucosky Brookman 10,000 shares of redeemable convertible Series E preferred stock (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Series E Preferred Stock&#8221;</font>) with a stated value of $45 per share as an alternative to providing a guarantee for the amount of the Lucosky Note.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000"> The Company, at its option, had the right to redeem for cash the outstanding shares of Series E Preferred Stock, upon written notice to the holder of the shares, at a cash redemption price equal to $45 multiplied by the number of shares being redeemed. Any such optional redemption by the Company would have resulted in a credit against the Lucosky Note.</font> During the period June 3, 2017 to December 29, 2017, Microphase incurred $21 of interest on <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">the Lucosky Note.</font> On December 29, 2017, the Lucosky Note was satisfied through the conversion of the 10,000 shares of Series E Preferred Stock into 600,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock (See Note 23).</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Other Notes Payable</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="zbfc5c74cdc6f4736aa44658f1539a7fb" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(h)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">Between May 5, 2017 and December 31, 2017, the Company received additional short-term loans of $297 from five accredited investors, of which $75 was from the Company&#8217;s corporate counsel, a related party. As additional consideration, the investors received five-year warrants to purchase 224,371 shares of common stock at a weighted average exercise price of $0.77 per share. The warrants are exercisable commencing six months after the issuance date and are&#160;subject&#160;to certain beneficial ownership limitations. The exercise price of these warrants is subject to adjustment for customary stock splits, stock dividends, combinations and other standard anti-dilution events. The warrants may be exercised for cash or on a cashless basis. During the quarter ended June 30, 2017, the Company recorded debt discount in the amount of $95 based on the estimated fair value of these warrants. The Company computed the fair value of these warrants using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. As a result of the short-term feature of these loans and advances, the debt discount was amortized as non-cash interest expense upon issuance of the warrants using the effective interest method.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">During June 2017, the holders of $55 of these short-term loans agreed to cancel their notes for the purchase of 100,001 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at a price of $0.55 per share. An additional $75 in short-term loans from the Company&#8217;s corporate counsel was converted into the Company&#8217;s equity securities; $52 was converted into one of the Series C Units and $23 was converted into the Company&#8217;s common stock. The Company did not record any additional interest expense as a result of the extinguishment of $130 in short-term loans since the carrying amount of the short-term loans was equivalent to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">the fair value of the consideration transferred, which was determined from the closing price of the Company&#8217;s equity securities on the date of </font>extinguishment<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">. During the year ended December 31, 2017, the Company also repaid $157 in short-term loans.</font></div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="zabe5adfa8d5f4a7f9821a89ab095ce66" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(i)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">In February 2017, the Company issued to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">eight accredited investors</font> $400 in demand promissory notes bearing interest at a rate of 6% per annum. Of the eight accredited investors, one investor was deemed a related party. As additional consideration, the investors received five-year warrants to purchase 333,333 shares of common stock at an exercise price of $0.70 per share (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Feb. 2017 Warrants&#8221;</font>). The Feb. 2017 Warrants are exercisable commencing six months after the issuance date and are&#160;subject&#160;to certain beneficial ownership limitations. The exercise price of the Feb. 2017 Warrants is subject to adjustment for customary stock splits, stock dividends, combinations and other standard anti-dilution events. The Feb. 2017 Warrants may be exercised for cash or on a cashless basis. During the quarter ended March 31, 2017, the Company recorded debt discount in the amount of $151 based on the estimated fair value of the Feb. 2017 Warrants. The Company computed the fair value of these warrants using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. As a result of the due on demand feature of the promissory notes, the debt discount was amortized as non-cash interest expense upon issuance of the Feb. 2017 Warrants using the effective interest method.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">Between February 16, 2017 and February 23, 2017, the holders of the $400 in demand promissory notes agreed to cancel their demand promissory notes for the purchase of 666,667 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, an extinguishment price of $0.60 per share. During the quarter ended March 31, 2017, the Company recorded additional interest expense of $13 as a result of the extinguishment of the $400 in demand promissory notes based on the difference of the carrying amount of the demand promissory notes and <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">the fair value of the consideration transferred, which was determined from the closing price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of </font>extinguishment<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="za34878ff8e7941f3a4076269b75ad034" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(j)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">On March 28, 2017, the Company issued $270 in demand promissory notes to several investors. These demand promissory notes accrued interest at the rate of 6% per annum. The Company received gross proceeds of $220 on March 31, 2017. The remaining balance of $50 was received on April 3, 2017. On April 5, 2017, the Company canceled these promissory notes by issuing to the investors 360,000 shares of common stock, at $0.75 per share, and warrants to purchase 180,002 shares of common stock at $0.90 per share. During the quarter ended June 30, 2017, the Company recorded additional interest expense of $109 as a result of the extinguishment of the $270 in demand promissory notes based on the difference of the carrying amount of the demand promissory notes and <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">the fair value of the consideration transferred, which was determined from the closing price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of </font>extinguishment<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">.</font></div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<div style="CLEAR: both">&#160;</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="zbc654ac09731449d9c502de5c09c45e3" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(a)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">On <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">December 29, 2016, the Company entered into an agreement with </font>MCKEA Holdings, LLC <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">(&#8220;MCKEA&#8221;</font>). MCKEA is the majority member of Philou Ventures, LLC, which is the Company&#8217;s controlling shareholder. Kristine L. Ault<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">, a director and the wife of Milton C. Ault III, Executive </font>Chairman of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">, is the manager and owner of MCKEA, for a demand promissory note (The </font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;MCKEA Note&#8221;</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">) in the amount of $250 bearing interest at the rate of 6% per annum on unpaid principal. The MCKEA Note may be prepaid, in whole or in part, without penalty, at the option of the Company and without the consent of MCKEA. As of December 31, 2016, no interest was accrued on the MCKEA Note.</font> On March 24, 2017<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">, the MCKEA Note was cancelled to purchase the Company&#8217;s </font>Series B Preferred Stock pursuant to the terms of the Preferred Stock Purchase Agreement entered into on March 9, 2017 (See Note 23). Since there was no difference between the reacquisition price and the net carrying value of the cancelled debt, no gain or loss was recognized as a result of this transaction.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z89833a6ef6d648ff91e3cc111d6fdecd" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(b)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">Microphase is a party to several notes payable agreements with seven of its past officers, employees and their family members. As of December 31, 2017, the aggregate outstanding balance pursuant to these notes payable agreements, inclusive of $47 of accrued interest, was $356, with annual interest rates ranging between 3.00% and 6.00%. During the period June 3, 2017 to September 30, 2017, Microphase incurred $10 of interest on these notes payable agreements. In July 2016, one of these noteholders initiated litigation to collect the balance owed under the terms of his respective agreement and in October 2017, Microphase and the noteholder entered into a settlement agreement whereby Microphase agreed to pay the outstanding principal and interest of $122 and $43, respectively, by issuing to the noteholder 95,834 shares of Microphase common stock valued at $115 and paying $25 in cash. The value of the Microphase common stock was derived from the Company&#8217;s recent acquisition of a majority interest in Microphase. Further, the parties agreed the final $25 would be paid within 18 months of the settlement agreement or Microphase would be required to pay the noteholder an additional $25.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both">&#160;</div>

<p style="margin: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">

<div>&#160;</div>

<div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DPW HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">DECEMBER 31, 2017</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share data</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</div>

<hr style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto" align="center" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="z1c241f4a898a42b892e7c0951631323d" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(a)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">On December 4, 2017, the Company entered into a securities purchase agreement to sell a 5% Convertible Note (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;5% Convertible Note&#8221;</font>) and 150,000 shares of restricted common stock to an institutional investor. The principal of the 5% Convertible Note and interest thereon may be converted into shares of common stock at $0.60 per share of common stock, subject to adjustments for lower priced issuances, stock splits, stock dividends, combinations or similar events. The 5% Convertible Note is in the principal amount of $550, <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">included an original issue discount (</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;OID&#8221;</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif">) of $50 resulting in net proceeds to the Company of </font>$500, bears interest at 5% simple interest on the principal amount, and is due on August 13, 2018. Interest only payments are due on a quarterly basis and the principal is due on June 3, 2018.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">At the time of issuance of the 5% Convertible Note, the closing price of the Company&#8217;s common stock was in excess of the conversion price, resulting in a BCF. The BCF embedded in the 5% <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Convertible Note</font> is accounted for under ASC No. <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">470,&#160;De</font>bt. At issuance, the intrinsic value of the BCF totaled $244 based on the difference between the effective conversion price and the fair value of the Company&#8217;s common stock at the commitment date of the transaction. The intrinsic value of the BCF exceeded the proceeds allocated to the relative fair value of the 5% Convertible Note. The BCF is being amortized to interest expense over the term of the 5% <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">Convertible Note</font> using the effective interest method.&#160; The valuation of the BCF was calculated based on the effective conversion price compared with the market price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of issuance of the Convertible Note.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">In aggregate, the Company recorded debt discount in the amount of $550 based on the relative fair values of the 150,000 shares of common stock of $256, BCF of $244 and OID of $50. The debt discount is being amortized as non-cash interest expense over the term of the debt. During the year ended December 31, 2017, non-cash interest expense of $381 was recorded from the amortization of debt discounts. In January 2018, the 5% Convertible Note was converted into 921,645 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock based upon the contractual rights included in the 5% Convertible Note.</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: left">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table id="zbd4b1a5fa7844bbf9cab09b1891862ba" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 18pt; align: right">(b)</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">On August 3, 2017, the Company entered into a securities purchase agreement to sell a 12% Convertible Note (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;12% Convertible Note&#8221;</font>) and a warrant to purchase 666,666 shares of common stock to an accredited investor. The principal of the 12% Convertible Note may be converted into shares of common stock at $0.55 per share and under the terms of the Warrant, up to 666,666 shares of common stock may be purchased at an exercise price of $0.70 per share.</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">&#160;</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">The 12% Convertible Note is in the principal amount of $400, included an OID of $40 resulting in net proceeds to the Company of $360, bears interest at 12% simple interest on the principal amount, and is due on August 13, 2018. Interest only payments are due on a quarterly basis and the principal is due on August 3, 2018. The principal may be converted into shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at $0.55 per share. &#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">The Company computed the fair value of the 666,666 warrants using the Black-Scholes option pricing model and, as a result of this calculation, recorded debt discount in the amount of $167 based on the estimated fair value of the 666,666 warrants.</div>

<div><br>
</div>

<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt">The beneficial conversion feature (<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;BCF&#8221;</font>) embedded in the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">12% Convertible Note </font>is accounted for under ASC No. <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">470,&#160;De</font>bt. At issuance, the intrinsic value of the BCF totaled $187. The Company, however, was prohibited from issuing shares of common stock pursuant to the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">12% Convertible Note </font>until stockholder approval of such issuance of securities was obtained as required by applicable NYSE American listing rules. The Company received stockholder approval for the share issuances on December 28, 2017. The intrinsic value of the BCF is being amortized to interest expense over the term of the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">12% Convertible Note</font> using the effective interest method. The valuation of the BCF was calculated based on the effective conversion price compared with the market price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of issuance of the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">12% Convertible Note</font>. In aggregate, the Company recorded debt discount in the amount of $394 based on the relative fair values of the 666,666 warrants, BCF and OID of $40. During the year ended December 31, 2017, non-cash interest expense of $212 was recorded from the amortization of debt discounts.</div>

<div>
<div>
<div style="CLEAR: both">&#160;</div>
